tweet:
[ notes ]

dX = diagnosis

case-matched: for each non-control study subject, there is a control subject with traits matched to relevant study variables

diagnostic-agnostic: compared all brains regardless of dX, clustered the results, THEN sorted by dX to label

Criteria for ADHD, autism, & OCD were established based on observed behavior before access to MRI brain imaging was available. 

So this study wanted to see if there were similarities/differences in brain structure:
1) within same dX
2) between dXs
3) compared to non-dX controls https://t.co/T4fgdMS4Fz

autism: 112

OCD: 34
controls: 22

Maria Montessori knew what was up

- lessons are called “work”
- age-heterogeneous classes

- autonomous work periods

tweet:
PTSD / cPTSD seem to be a lot like autoimmunity, to me, in that they take a system designed to keep us safe from harm, & starts using it to cause damage to other parts of our mind if left unchecked. 

Recovery is exhausting & difficult, but absolutely possible.

I’m using a broad definition here—I mean privilege of:

- sustenance, incl ability to be employed
- sensory environment: can your body relax?
- community: others to fill self-care gaps, emotional support, co-regulation
- mobility/access: if you need something, can you get it?
